name: *Basic concepts*
overview: This section explains concepts that are critical to understanding *C++.*

page_1.article: Each variable has a specific type. And this type determines what values ​​a variable can have, what operations can be performed with it and how many bytes in memory it will occupy. The following basic data types are defined in *C++*:
page_1.bool: *bool:* logical type. It can take one of two values - _​True_ and _False_. The size of the occupied memory for this type is not precisely defined.
page_1.char: *char:* represents a single ASCII character. It occupies `1 byte` (8 bits) in memory. Can store any value from `-128` to `127`, or `0` to `255`.
page_1.signed_char: *signed char:* represents one character. It occupies `1 byte` (8 bits) in memory. Can store any value from `-128` to `127`.
page_1.unsigned_char: *unsigned char:* represents one character. It occupies `1 byte` (8 bits) in memory. Can store any value from `0` to `255`.
page_1.wchar_t: *wchar_t:* represents a wide character. On Windows it occupies `2` bytes (16 bits) in memory, on Linux it takes `4` bytes (32 bits). Can store any value from `0` to `65,535` (for 2 bytes), or `0` to `4,294,967,295` (for 4 bytes).
page_1.char16_t: *char16_t:* represents a single Unicode character. It occupies `2` bytes (16 bits) in memory. Can store any value from `0` to `65535`.

page_2.char32_t: *char32_t:* represents a single Unicode character. It occupies 4 bytes (32 bits) in memory. Can store any value from 0 to 4,294,967,295
page_2.short: *short:* represents an integer in the range from –32768 to 32767. Occupies 2 bytes (16 bits) in memory
page_2.unsigned short: *unsigned short:* represents an integer in the range from 0 to 65535. Occupies 2 bytes (16 bits) in memory
